result.execSummary:
The defendant Fitzgerald Blackman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon:  his voting rights are suspended, he must provide a DNA sample,  and he may never possess firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Provide DNA sample.  Pay all applicable csots, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC during period of Extended supervision or civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Abigail C.  Agent may allow nonviolent contact if appropriate and victim agrees.
May have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complee Batterers Intervention counseling and continued programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfuly complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.   Successfuly complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fitzgerald Blackman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing 6/3/2014 received and filed. (43 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Dodge Correctional.

Correcting Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the clerk's office shall correct the judgment of conviction to state that the sentencing date is 6-3-2014.   mld
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. mag

Defendant Fitzgerald Blackman in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Fitzgerald Blackman in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Additional statements by: Danella H.   
 AS TO CHARGE w/o repeater enhancer; the Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS (concurrent to any other sentence), with 144 days credit for pretrial incarcaration; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Abigail C.  
   Agent may allow non-violent contact if 
   appropriate and victim agrees.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of extended supervision, 
   or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Supervision.   mld

Defendant Fitzgerald Blackman in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Fitzgerald Blackman in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the penalty enhancer, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec.939.62(1)(c), stricken from the record.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Fitzgerald Blackman in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Fitzgerald Blackman in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Parties stipulate to repeater status for purposes of this hearing only.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Matthew Grauberger.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, with the stipulation of the parties, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery from the State.  Defense preserves further agrument regarding the penalty enhancer.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4 on 4-16-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ABIGAIL C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Fitzgerald Blackman in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Fitzgerald Blackman in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
